title: Calories in Kalamata Olives
meta_description: Discover calories in kalamata olives per 100g, including fat, sodium, carbs, protein, and serving tips for Mediterranean diets.
assumptions: Brine-cured, pitted kalamata olives; drained weight; no added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, curing method, brine concentration, and pitting; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of kalamata olives provides ~215 kcal, mostly from healthy fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Rinse to reduce sodium (minimal calorie change)
Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g kalamata olives?
Are kalamata olives high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 20 g total fat per 100 g, mostly monounsaturated.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in kalamata olives?
faqs.a: Around 2000 mg per 100 g due to brining; rinse to lower it.
Yes, roughly 3.2 g dietary fiber per 100 g.

faqs.q: How many kalamata olives in a serving?
faqs.a: About 5-7 olives (30-50 g) for a typical serving, equating to 65-110 kcal.
